newsitem.title: SPAIN: Arafat marks peace conference anniversary in Spain.
newsitem.headline: Arafat marks peace conference anniversary in Spain.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat arrived in Spain on Wednesday to mark the anniversary of the 1991 conference in Madrid which formed a landmark in Middle East peacemaking.

Foreign Ministry spokesman Inocencio Arias said Spain attributed great importance to Arafat's visit but wanted to "stay out of the limelight of Middle East peace policies conducted by the United States with the cooperation of the European Union".
The EU, seeking a higher profile in the Middle East, named Spain's ambassador to Israel, Miguel Angel Moratinos, on Monday, as special envoy to track the falting peace process.
Arafat, who arrived from Algiers, was to meet Spanish Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar and King Juan Carlos on Thursday.
Spain has also invitated Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to visit "on or around" the October 31 anniversary. Netanyahu has not yet replied.

The Madrid conference in 1991 gave Palestinians their first opportunity to speak for themselves on a world stage and started a process that later won them a degree of self-rule in Gaza and the West Bank.
